intro: Tetraria laxa, commonly known as the slender tetraria, is a small, annual herbaceous plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils in temperate regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Tetraria laxa is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in other open, sunny habitats.
